title: Major terror attack foiled, over 30 terrorists arrested in Punjab province of Pakistan
content: Law enforcement agencies in Punjab province of Pakistan have arrested 33 terrorists from various banned groups including Al-Qaeda and foiled a significant terror plot. The Counter Terrorism Department conducted 475 intelligence-based operations across different districts, interrogating suspects and recovering weapons and explosives. Cases have been registered against the detained individuals.
summary: Law enforcement agencies in Punjab province of Pakistan have arrested 33 terrorists from various banned groups including Al-Qaeda and foiled a significant terror plot. The Counter Terrorism Department conducted 475 intelligence-based operations across different districts, interrogating suspects and recovering weapons and explosives. Cases have been registered against the detained individuals.

title: Super Typhoon Yagi hits Vietnam: At least four killed amid widespread destruction
content: Super Typhoon Yagi struck northern Vietnam, leading to at least four deaths and extensive damage. The typhoon uprooted trees, displaced boats, and tore roofs off houses. In anticipation of the devastations, authorities evacuated thousands of residents to safer areas. Before hitting Vietnam, it left a trail of destruction in Southern China and the Philippines.
summary: Super Typhoon Yagi struck northern Vietnam, leading to at least four deaths and extensive damage. The typhoon uprooted trees, displaced boats, and tore roofs off houses. In anticipation of the devastations, authorities evacuated thousands of residents to safer areas. Before hitting Vietnam, it left a trail of destruction in Southern China and the Philippines.

title: Olympic rings to stay on Eiffel Tower until 2028: Paris mayor
Mexico arrests alleged drug boss linked to 43 missing students
content: A suspected drug cartel boss allegedly linked to the disappearance a decade ago of 43 college students was arrested in Mexico after being released from prison in 2019, authorities said Friday. In September 2014, the 43 students had been traveling to a political demonstration in Mexico City when investigators believe they were kidnapped by the drug cartel in collusion with corrupt police.
summary: A suspected drug cartel boss allegedly linked to the disappearance a decade ago of 43 college students was arrested in Mexico after being released from prison in 2019, authorities said Friday. In September 2014, the 43 students had been traveling to a political demonstration in Mexico City when investigators believe they were kidnapped by the drug cartel in collusion with corrupt police.

title: In rare move, heads of CIA, MI6 issue joint call for ceasefire in Gaza
content: CIA Director William Burns and MI6 Chief Richard Moore have called for a ceasefire in Gaza to de-escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict. They emphasised their intelligence efforts to broker peace and end civilian suffering. The chiefs also discussed global threats from Russia, China, and terrorism while praising Ukraine's resilience against Russian aggression.
summary: CIA Director William Burns and MI6 Chief Richard Moore have called for a ceasefire in Gaza to de-escalate the Israel-Hamas conflict. They emphasised their intelligence efforts to broker peace and end civilian suffering. The chiefs also discussed global threats from Russia, China, and terrorism while praising Ukraine's resilience against Russian aggression.

title: Michael Anthony Guider, convicted pedophile who killed schoolgirl Samantha Knight, dies in custody
content: Michael Anthony Guider, a convicted pedophile who murdered nine-year-old Samantha Knight and abused more than a dozen children, died in custody at age 73. Initially sentenced to 17 years, he was released in 2019 but re-arrested in 2022 for violating supervision conditions. Samantha's mother expressed anger over his release.
summary: Michael Anthony Guider, a convicted pedophile who murdered nine-year-old Samantha Knight and abused more than a dozen children, died in custody at age 73. Initially sentenced to 17 years, he was released in 2019 but re-arrested in 2022 for violating supervision conditions. Samantha's mother expressed anger over his release.

title: Russian army captures village in Ukraine's eastern Donetsk region
content: Russian forces have taken control of Kalynove village in Ukraine's Donetsk region, according to the Russian Defence Ministry. This marks a significant advance in their offensive. In another incident, artillery shelling in Kostyantynivka killed three people and injured three others, causing damage to multiple buildings as the frontline approaches.
summary: Russian forces have taken control of Kalynove village in Ukraine's Donetsk region, according to the Russian Defence Ministry. This marks a significant advance in their offensive. In another incident, artillery shelling in Kostyantynivka killed three people and injured three others, causing damage to multiple buildings as the frontline approaches.

title: Watch: Ukraine deploys 'dragon drones' that drop molten metal on Russian forces
content: Ukraine has introduced 'dragon drones' that deploy thermite against Russian forces. Thermite burns at temperatures up to 4,000 degrees Fahrenheit and can incinerate almost anything. Historically used in both World Wars, this weapon raises issues regarding international humanitarian law due to its destructive capacity and potential for causing extensive environmental damage.
summary: Ukraine has introduced 'dragon drones' that deploy thermite against Russian forces. Thermite burns at temperatures up to 4,000 degrees Fahrenheit and can incinerate almost anything. Historically used in both World Wars, this weapon raises issues regarding international humanitarian law due to its destructive capacity and potential for causing extensive environmental damage.

title: Putin gifts Kim Jong-un 24 horses in exchange for artillery shells used in Ukraine war
content: Vladimir Putin has presented North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with 24 purebred Orlov Trotters as partial payment for artillery shells used in Russiaâ€™s ongoing conflict in Ukraine. This exchange is part of a continuing diplomatic tradition, highlighting North Korea's substantial investment in thoroughbred horses and their symbolic significance to Kim's regime.
summary: Vladimir Putin has presented North Korean leader Kim Jong-un with 24 purebred Orlov Trotters as partial payment for artillery shells used in Russiaâ€™s ongoing conflict in Ukraine. This exchange is part of a continuing diplomatic tradition, highlighting North Korea's substantial investment in thoroughbred horses and their symbolic significance to Kim's regime.

title: Man in California charged with killing 81 animals in a 3-hour shooting spree
content: Vicente Arroyo, aged 39, faces charges for killing 81 animals in a three-hour shooting spree in Northern California. He pleaded not guilty to animal cruelty and other offenses. Authorities seized multiple firearms, including illegal weapons. His mental health is under evaluation, and he remains in custody on $1 million bail.
summary: Vicente Arroyo, aged 39, faces charges for killing 81 animals in a three-hour shooting spree in Northern California. He pleaded not guilty to animal cruelty and other offenses. Authorities seized multiple firearms, including illegal weapons. His mental health is under evaluation, and he remains in custody on $1 million bail.

title: Prince William's royal plans: No room for Harry and Meghan after becoming king?
content: Prince William is strategizing for his future reign by distancing himself from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. An insider disclosed that William does not foresee a place for the Sussexes within the Royal Family, potentially leading to an irreversible separation. The rift between the brothers remains deep, especially after Harry's memoir, Spare.
summary: Prince William is strategizing for his future reign by distancing himself from Prince Harry and Meghan Markle. An insider disclosed that William does not foresee a place for the Sussexes within the Royal Family, potentially leading to an irreversible separation. The rift between the brothers remains deep, especially after Harry's memoir, Spare.

title: 'God made me do it': American mom accused of killing 2 of her children fights extradition
content: An American woman, Kimberlee Singler, accused of killing her two children in Colorado, claims God made her do it. Singler is fighting extradition to the US, arguing that a life sentence without parole violates European human rights law. The case involves a custody battle and allegations of coerced statements from her surviving daughter.
summary: An American woman, Kimberlee Singler, accused of killing her two children in Colorado, claims God made her do it. Singler is fighting extradition to the US, arguing that a life sentence without parole violates European human rights law. The case involves a custody battle and allegations of coerced statements from her surviving daughter.

title: Pakistan: Karachi residents grapple with 12-hour power outages due to illegal electricity sales, infrastructure issues
content: Karachi residents endure prolonged power outages and electricity theft, disrupting daily life and schoolwork. Load shedding spans up to 12 hours, causing significant inconvenience. Local individuals allegedly sell electricity illegally with the help of K-Electric employees. Although steps are being taken to address these issues, implementation remains slow.
summary: Karachi residents endure prolonged power outages and electricity theft, disrupting daily life and schoolwork. Load shedding spans up to 12 hours, causing significant inconvenience. Local individuals allegedly sell electricity illegally with the help of K-Electric employees. Although steps are being taken to address these issues, implementation remains slow.

title: US President Biden to host British PM Starmer next week, will discuss Ukraine and Gaza issues
content: President Joe Biden will meet British Prime Minister Keir Starmer next week to discuss key global issues including the Ukraine war and Gaza conflict. The talks will focus on supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression and seeking a ceasefire in Gaza. Other topics include Houthi rebel attacks and countering Chinese influence in the Asia-Pacific region.
summary: President Joe Biden will meet British Prime Minister Keir Starmer next week to discuss key global issues including the Ukraine war and Gaza conflict. The talks will focus on supporting Ukraine against Russian aggression and seeking a ceasefire in Gaza. Other topics include Houthi rebel attacks and countering Chinese influence in the Asia-Pacific region.

title: Russiaâ€™s election interference aims to boost Trumpâ€™s chances against Harris, warn US intel
content: US intelligence officials reveal that Russia is intensifying its efforts to influence the upcoming presidential election, targeting Donald Trumpâ€™s campaign against Vice President Kamala Harris. The interference operation involves sophisticated tactics, including using American media personalities to spread pro-Kremlin narratives and focusing on down-ballot races. Both campaigns have been briefed on these foreign influence activities.
summary: US intelligence officials reveal that Russia is intensifying its efforts to influence the upcoming presidential election, targeting Donald Trumpâ€™s campaign against Vice President Kamala Harris. The interference operation involves sophisticated tactics, including using American media personalities to spread pro-Kremlin narratives and focusing on down-ballot races. Both campaigns have been briefed on these foreign influence activities.

title: Watch: Boeingâ€™s Starliner returns to earth without astronauts
content: Boeing's Starliner capsule returned to Earth without astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who remain on the ISS due to technical issues. The spacecraft faced thruster malfunctions and propulsion system leaks, causing NASA to delay their return until February 2025. Boeing will investigate these problems for future missions.
summary: Boeing's Starliner capsule returned to Earth without astronauts Sunita Williams and Butch Wilmore, who remain on the ISS due to technical issues. The spacecraft faced thruster malfunctions and propulsion system leaks, causing NASA to delay their return until February 2025. Boeing will investigate these problems for future missions.

title: How the fight to define Kamala Harris will shape next week's debate
'Dick Cheney will be voting for Kamala Harris': Former VP turns his back on Trump, tells daughter Liz
content: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a lifelong Republican, will vote for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election, according to his daughter Liz Cheney. This unprecedented endorsement signifies a major break from his party and opposition to Donald Trump. The move highlights the deep divisions within the GOP regarding Trump's influence as other prominent Republicans also distance themselves from him.
summary: Former Vice President Dick Cheney, a lifelong Republican, will vote for Kamala Harris in the 2024 presidential election, according to his daughter Liz Cheney. This unprecedented endorsement signifies a major break from his party and opposition to Donald Trump. The move highlights the deep divisions within the GOP regarding Trump's influence as other prominent Republicans also distance themselves from him.

title: Thirteen Palestinians killed in Israeli strikes on Gaza, WAFA says
content: Israeli airstrikes on a school used as a refugee shelter and a residential building in Gaza resulted in at least 13 Palestinian deaths and 15 injuries. The Israeli military claimed the targets were Hamas command centers. This incident is part of an ongoing conflict that has caused massive casualties and displacement among Gaza's population.
summary: Israeli airstrikes on a school used as a refugee shelter and a residential building in Gaza resulted in at least 13 Palestinian deaths and 15 injuries. The Israeli military claimed the targets were Hamas command centers. This incident is part of an ongoing conflict that has caused massive casualties and displacement among Gaza's population.

title: Canada: Ontarioâ€™s first human rabies case in over 50 years linked to 'direct contact' with bat
content: Canadian province Ontario reports its first human rabies case since 1967, involving a Brantford-Brant resident exposed to a bat in the Timiskaming region. The patient is receiving treatment, and health officials urge those with direct bat contact to seek medical care. Close contacts are being assessed and offered post-exposure prophylaxis.
summary: Canadian province Ontario reports its first human rabies case since 1967, involving a Brantford-Brant resident exposed to a bat in the Timiskaming region. The patient is receiving treatment, and health officials urge those with direct bat contact to seek medical care. Close contacts are being assessed and offered post-exposure prophylaxis.
